question: 獣
sourceMnemonic: The kanji and the word are exactly the same. That means they share meanings as well.
sourceReadingMnemonic:
Since this word is made up of a single kanji, it probably uses the kun'yomi reading. You did not learn this reading, so here's a mnemonic to help you remember: 

A <vocabulary>beast</vocabulary>... what do you think of when you think of a beast? How about a thing (<ja>物</ja>, <ja>もの</ja>) full of fur (<ja>毛</ja>, <ja>け</ja>), aka a <ja>けもの</ja> (fur thing)? A beast is a fur thing, and in Japanese that's <ja>けもの</ja>. Punnnns.
